name: Keirnel's Quest
description:
Join Keirnel on his early 2000's style quest to win his dog's affection through platforming challenges in a world made by people who didn't want to learn how to make terrain inside of unreal engine.  Enjoy platforming challenges that are somewhat unfair but short enough that you don't give up hope, then talk to the locals that just happen to all be ducks [besides your caring and wonderful dog].

Controls:

Mouse:

Move: WASD or Arrow Keys
Camera: Mouse (can invert in options menu)
Jump: Space-Bar
Interact: E
Pause: P or Escape

Controller (Only tested with Xbox controller)

Move: Left Stick or D-pad
Camera: Right Stick (can invert in options menu)
Jump: A
Interact: X or B
Pause: Start

This is a semester-long project for a game design class done by a team of 3 people in the span of a couple months, although after the semester ended there was a lot of work done into polishing the game.

Features:

  • A whole new world to explore
  • Coins to collect
  • 4 Unique items to find
  • Unique NPCs to talk to
  • 2 Original songs
  • Xbox controller support
  • The gradual descent into madness as students learn the horrors of game development

Credits:

Daniel Haller - World Design, Level Design, 2D/3D Art, Animations, Music, Programming
Mel Daugherty - Programming, Writing, and Awesome Dialogue System
Richmond Vang - 2D/3D Art, Animations

Special Thanks to:
Ben Geisler - Professor
Basically 50 unreal engine forms for troubleshooting
You for actually reading this (and maybe playing :)))))

Make sure you check out my other game I worked on Heart and Home
